context: The Finnish word 'alhainen' is an adjective that primarily means 'low' or 'short'. It can refer to physical height (a short person), level/position (low blood pressure, low status), or quality (low quality). The form shown appears to be in nominative singular. In different contexts it might take different forms: alhainen (nom sing), alempi (comparative), alhaisin (superlative), or decline for case and number such as 'alhaista' (partitive) or 'alhaiset' (nominative plural).
